subject: RE: [junit] where there has abstract method in interface
msgSnippet: ... I tend to add public in my interface methods as well, it makes it easier to copy/paste into the implementing class (although Eclipse is taking care of
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On

> A fine point. It might therefore have been Visual Age for
> Java throwing that stuff in. I seem to recall that it did that. :)

I tend to add "public" in my interface methods as well, it makes it easier
to copy/paste into the implementing class (although Eclipse is taking care
of this for me most of the time).
